summary: This bill, the "Commission to Relocate the Federal Bureaucracy Act," establishes a commission to study and recommend the relocation of non-security-related federal agencies from the Washington, D.C. metropolitan area to other regions of the United States. Composed of various cabinet secretaries and agency heads, the commission must submit a report to Congress within one year. The report's recommendations will be based on factors including financial efficiency (such as lower cost of living), the availability of infrastructure, synergy with existing local industries, and the agency's recent history of using telework.
